We’re artists. We gamble. We test crypto casinos between painting sessions and digital commissions. That’s just how we roll at the-artists.org.

We’ve tested every single one that opened in 2025, lost some money, won some back, and figured out which ones are worth your time.

Top New Bitcoin Casinos – Crypto Gambling Sites 2025

Okay, so here’s the deal. We spent way too much of our Bitcoin earnings this year testing new crypto casino platforms. Started in January with high hopes, got burned by some terrible sites, but found a few gems. Our studio has become an unofficial testing ground for these platforms.

Between commission deadlines and gallery prep, we somehow managed to gamble at every new crypto casino that launched this year. Some were complete disasters. Others? Actually impressive.

Started: March 2025 | What We Rate It: 9.3/10 | Do Artists Dig It: You bet

So these Claps people contacted us back in February. “Hey, want to test our new crypto casino?” We get these messages constantly. Usually it’s garbage. This time? Different story entirely.

First thing that caught our attention – they actually asked what features artists would want. Nobody does that. Most casinos just assume we want the same stuff as regular gamblers.

Our sculptor buddy Jake tested a 0.6 BTC withdrawal at 2 AM last Tuesday. Money hit his wallet by 2:05 AM. No verification delays, no customer service runaround.

Security & Licensing

Look, we’ve all heard horror stories about crypto platforms vanishing overnight with everyone’s money. That’s why we’re paranoid about security. Every casino we recommend survived our thorough security interrogation.

What Licenses Actually Mean:

Curaçao Gaming Authority – Where most new crypto casinos get licensed

    • We actually called their office to verify licenses (yes, we’re that paranoid)

    • They have specific rules for crypto operations

    • Do compliance checks every three months

    • Handle player complaints when things go wrong

Malta Gaming Authority (MGA) – The fancy option

    • Much stricter about finances and operations

    • Better protection for players

    • European credibility

    • Monthly reports on casino finances

Kahnawake Gaming Commission – North American alternative

    • Based in Canada, understands North American players

    • More flexible with crypto regulations

    • Actually cares about creative communities

    • Focuses on community concerns

Security Stuff We Actually Checked:

How to Choose the Best New Crypto Casino

We learned the hard way. Lost money on sketchy platforms before figuring out what to look for. Here’s what we wish we knew from the start.

How We Check Out New Casinos:

1. License Stuff

    • Look up if the gaming authority is real or fake

    • Actually call them (we’re nerds like that) to check license numbers

    • See how they deal with players who get screwed over

    • Check if they force casinos to show their money situation

2. Testing Games

    • Try playing on phones, tablets, laptops to see what breaks

    • Find out which companies make the games

    • Look for games about art or that look cool

    • See if mobile crashes when we place bets

3. Bonus Bullshit Detection

    • Get out the calculator to see what bonuses really give you

    • Try cashing out fifty bucks first

    • See what normal people get versus what artists get

    • Actually try to claim bonuses instead of just reading

4. Money Stuff

    • Send actual Bitcoin to see if it works

    • Try getting money back to our wallets

    • Count up fees and see how long it takes

    • Figure out their verification crap

5. Community Checking

    • Jump in their chat rooms and Discord

    • Hunt for art tournaments or creative stuff

    • See if they actually care about artists or just pretend

    • Check if real artists actually hang out there

Shit That Makes Us Run Away:

    • ❌ No License – We skip unlicensed places now

    • ❌ Weird Rules – If we can’t figure out their terms, screw it

    • ❌ Artists Bitching – When creators complain about a place, we pay attention

    • ❌ Crappy Support – We bug customer service before putting in real money

    • ❌ Crazy Bonuses – Nobody really gives 3000% bonuses

    • ❌ Busted Mobile – We do half our gambling on phones

    • ❌ Only Bitcoin – Decent places take multiple coins

Our Testing Routine:

    1. Signing Up: See what personal crap they want from us

    1. Putting Money In: Try different cryptos with various amounts

    1. Playing Games: Gamble for weeks, not just one session

    1. Taking Money Out: Actually withdraw cash to see if it works

    1. Bugging Support: Contact help through every way possible

    1. Artist Stuff: Test community features and creative programs

We blew money figuring this out. Made stupid mistakes so you won’t.
